p: A. paniculata exhibited, in vitro and in vivo, various pharmacological activities, including antihyperglycemic, antiplatelet aggregation, anti-microbial, anti-inflammatory, anti-HIV, anti-cancer, anti-nociceptive activity, etc. It has also been used for autoimmune encephalomyelitis and, in Indian and Chinese medicine, for respiratory tract infections [ 217, 219].
